{"step_by_step_thinking": "Freud's phallic stage occurs from ages three to six. This is when children become aware of their bodies and the bodies of others. Piaget's stages of cognitive development do not directly correspond to Freud's stages of psychosexual development. However, if we were to draw parallels based on the age range, Piaget's preoperational stage, which occurs from ages two to seven, would be the closest match.", "answer_choice": "B. Pre operational"}
